alert.note: Alert for Borden; Dawson; Howard; Martin (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 02 at 5:42PM CDT until June 02 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Borden County in western Texas... Howard County in western Texas... Northeastern Martin County in western Texas... Southeastern Dawson County in western Texas... * Until 645 PM CDT. * At 542 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 12 miles southeast of Lamesa Municipal Airport to near Ackerly to 6 miles east of Lenorah to 12 miles northwest of Stanton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Big Spring, Ackerly, Coahoma, Sand Springs, Lenorah, Luther, J B Thomas Reservoir, Sparenberg, Vincent, Big Spring Country Club, Big Spring McMahon-Wrinkle Airpark, Knott, Vealmoor and Elbow. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 165 and 196. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for western Texas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for western Texas.
